chargeHist.descr: Child Sex Offender Working with Children
Child Sex Offender Working with Children

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale W Neumann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Sex Offender Working with Children, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.13(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court orders 6 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 3 years Initial Confinement and 3 years Extended Supervision with conditions, consecutive to his current sentence.
4/11/16:  Amended to add defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE TO CURRENT SENTENCE

superMiscConds.notes: PAY COURT COSTS AND DOC SUPERVISION FEES AS DIRECTED BY AGENT
COMPLY WITH ANY TREATMENT DEEMED NECESSARY BY PROBATION  AGENT TO INCLUDE SEX OFFENDER TREATMENT

*Not be on the premises where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, including but not limited to bars, taverns, liquor stores; unless approved by the Agent
*Not to associate with anyone using alcohol or drugs or have contact with anyone under active community supervision without prior Agent approval
*No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior Agent approval and in the presence of an adult sober chaperone approved by the Department of Corrections
*No possession of any weapons
*Not to leave Portage County without prior Agent approval

PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE IF NOT ALREADY DONE.
MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
REMAIN COMPLIANT WITH SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE TO CURRENT SENTENCE

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dale W Neumann in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Defendant Dale W Neumann in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Interpreter also appearing with Mr. Neumann.
Court will not that the Interpreter has already been sworn for a previous hearing today.
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the original PSI.  Parties have also received an alternative PSI from Barry Hargan & Associates that was requested by the defense.
Court received both copies of the PSI.  Court questions counsel.  Atty Lawton states that the defendant has received both PSI's and not changes to either reports.
Atty Hendee requests 6 years Prison with 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision with conditions.  All conditions listed on page 20 of the PSI.
Atty Lawton makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 6 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 3 years Initial Confinement and 3 years Extended Supervision with conditions, consecutive to his current sentence.
*Court Costs = $268.00
*DNA Sample + DNA Surcharge (if not done so already)
*Remain compliant with Sex Offender Registry Program
*Not be on the premises wherre the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, including but not limited to bars, taverns, liquor stores; unless approved by the Agent
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety
*Not to associate with anyone using alcohol or drugs or have contact with anyone under active community supervision without prior Agent approval
*Maintain full time employment
*No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior Agent approval and in the presence of an adult sober chaperone approved by the Department of Corrections
*No possession of any weapons
*Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by your Agent to include Sex Offender Treatment
*Pay court costs and Department of Corrections  Supervision fees as directed by the Agent
*Not to leave Portage County without prior Agent approval
Challange Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse programs; defendant does not qualify

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
ALTERNATIVE PRESENTENCE INVESTIGATION REPORT

records.addlTxt: AMENDED - DOC NOTICE LOST BETWEEN OUR OFFICE & THEIR'S - RE-SET SENTENCE DATE
Sentencing hearing on December 5, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on November 24, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on October 31, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Dale W Neumann in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF29 & 14CF34:
Interpreter Dawn Ruthe sworn.
Atty Hendee states that at the last hearing the defendant waived the Prelim in both matters. Since that hearing; the state has filed the information in both cases.  The parties will be requesting a PSI and setting a sentencing date.  Atty Hendee states what the plea agreement.
Atty Lawton agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.   Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 14CF29.  
14CF34 will be dismissed and read-in.
PSI ordered.
Set for Sentencing
bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on September 11, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Dale W Neumann in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF29 & 14CF34:
Interpreter Dawn Ruthe sworn.  
Atty Hendee states that the defendant will be waiving his right to a Prelim in both cases.  Atty Hendee states that he does not have the information yet and asks that this be set for an Arraignment.
Atty Lawton has no objection to that.  Atty Lawton states that the defendant will waive the right to a Preliminary Hearing on both cases.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees to the waiver of the Prelim.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

BY THE COURT:  Set Arraignment on both cases.
Atty Hendee will file the information with the court.
bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Return date on July 30, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Dale W Neumann in court with attorney Mark D Lawton.  Defendant Dale W Neumann in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Interpreter Kate Block sworn by the clerk.
14CF29 & 14CF34:
Atty Lawton states that the matters are not resolved at this time and asks for a 30 day reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.

Atty Hendee states that a bond is not set on 14CF34 and asks that the bond from 14CF29 cover that case as well.
Atty Lawton has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Bond will cover both cases.  Return date scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Letter from Atty Jeffrey Haase dated 04-16-14 w/enc:
1) Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Return date on May 21, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Dale W Neumann in court with attorney Jeffrey T Haase.  Defendant Dale W Neumann in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sign Interpreter Dawn Ruthe sworn.  
Atty Hendee states that in talking with Atty Haase; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim.  Atty Haase agrees and states that the defendant will waive the Prelim.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant doesn't fully understand.
Recess to give defendant time to speak with Atty Haase.
Atty Haase states the defendant will waive the Prelim.  Defendant agrees and waives the Prelim.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the court.
  Atty Haase states that the Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.  Atty Haase enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.

Atty Hendee states that the defendant has been revoked on ES; based on that, the state moves to amend the cash bond to a signature bond with same conditions.
Defendant wants the cash bond to stay in place.
BY THE COURT:  Cash bond will be continued.

Atty Haase asks that the court order the jail to meet in a conference room face to face
BY THE COURT:  Court will order the jail to allow the defendant to meet with Atty Haase face to face.  If there is any objection from the jail; the court will take up that objection.
  Return date scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dale W Neumann in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Interpreter Dawn Ruthe appears.  
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant contacted Atty Jeff Haase and was going to be here today at 1:00pm with the defendant.  Interpreter cannot be here at 1:00pm today.    Court will proceed.   Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court reads the charges.  Court questions the defendant regarding the Preliminary Hearing.  Court will set a Prelim within the 10 days.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Prelim.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.

**NEEDS SIGN LANGUAGE INTERPRETER**

Defendant Dale W Neumann in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant was just served a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court questions the defendant to make sure that he is ok with reading the computer screen to see what is going on with the hearing.  Defendant states that he is ok with reading the screen.  
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Atty Hendee states charges in that complaint and requests a $5,000 cash bond with condition of no unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 16.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  
Defendant asks for a signature bond and states that he is on social security.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $2,500 cash bond with conditions:
No unsupervised contact with any minor child under the age of 16.
  Initial appearance scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
